conclusion: State A has coordinates Pₐ = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, Vₐ = 2 L
State C has coordinates P꜀ = 1 × 10⁵ Pa, V꜀ = 5 L
For an ideal gas in a closed system the mole number n is fixed
P V = n R T ⟹ P V ⁄ T = constant along the entire cycle
Equate the ratios for states A and C: (Pₐ Vₐ)/Tₐ = (P꜀ V꜀)/T꜀
Solve for T꜀: T꜀ = Tₐ (P꜀ V꜀)/(Pₐ Vₐ)
Calculate T꜀: T꜀ = 200 K × (1 × 10⁵ Pa × 5 L)/(1 × 10⁵ Pa × 2 L)
Simplify to find T꜀ = 200 K × 5/2 = 500 K
The temperature of the gas at state C is 500 K
